00098 #include <unistd.h>
00099 #include <sys/types.h>

00101 #include <time.h>
00102 #include <pthread.h>

00124 cache_content_status_t cache_content_flush(  cache_content_entry_t           * pentry,
00125                                              cache_content_flush_behaviour_t   flushhow,
00126                                              cache_content_client_t          * pclient,
00127                                              fsal_op_context_t               * pcontext,
00128                                              cache_content_status_t          * pstatus ) 
00129 {
00130    fsal_handle_t           * pfsal_handle = NULL ;
00131    fsal_status_t             fsal_status ;
00132    cache_inode_status_t      cache_inode_status ;
00133    fsal_path_t               local_path ;
00134    cache_entry_t           * pentry_inode = NULL ;
00135    char                      datapathmoved[MAXPATHLEN] ;
00136 
00137 
00138    /* Get the related cache inode entry */
00139    pentry_inode = (cache_entry_t *)pentry->pentry_inode ;   
00140 
00141    *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ;
00142    
00143    /* stat */
00144    pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH] += 1 ;
00145    
00146    /* Get the fsal handle */
00147    if( ( pfsal_handle = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( pentry->pentry_inode, &cache_inode_status) ) == NULL )
00148      {
00149        *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_BAD_CACHE_INODE_ENTRY ;
00150        
00151        DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_MAJOR, 
00152                           "cache_content_new_entry: cannot get handle" ) ;
00153        /* stat */
00154        pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH] += 1 ;
00155        
00156        return *pstatus ;
00157      }
00158 
00159    /* Lock related Cache Inode pentry to avoid concurrency while read/write operation */
00160    P( pentry->pentry_inode->lock ) ;
00161 
00162    snprintf( datapathmoved, MAXPATHLEN, "%s.about_to_be_flushed", pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data ) ;
00163 
00164    if( rename( pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data, datapathmoved) == -1 )
00165      {
00166         /* Unlock related Cache Inode pentry */
00167         V( pentry->pentry_inode->lock ) ;
00168 
00169         *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00170         return *pstatus ;
00171      }
00172 
00173    /* Convert the path to FSAL path */
00174    fsal_status =  FSAL_str2path( datapathmoved, MAXPATHLEN, &local_path )  ;
00175    
00176    if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00177       {
00178        *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_FSAL_ERROR ;
00179        
00180        /* Unlock related Cache Inode pentry */
00181        V( pentry->pentry_inode->lock ) ;
00182 
00183        /* stat */
00184        pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH] += 1 ;
00185        
00186        return *pstatus ;
00187      }
00188 
00189 #ifdef _USE_PROXY
00190    fsal_status = FSAL_rcp_by_name( &(pentry_inode->object.file.pentry_parent_open->object.dir_begin.handle),
00191                                    pentry_inode->object.file.pname, 
00192                                    pcontext,
00193                                    &local_path,
00194                                    FSAL_RCP_LOCAL_TO_FS ) ; 
00195 #else
00196    /* Write the data from the local data file to the fs file */
00197    fsal_status = FSAL_rcp( pfsal_handle, 
00198                            pcontext, 
00199                            &local_path,
00200                            FSAL_RCP_LOCAL_TO_FS ) ;
00201 #endif
00202 
00203    if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00204      {
00205 #ifdef _USE_PROXY
00206        DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_MAJOR, 
00207                           "Error %d,%d from FSAL_rcp_by_name when flushing file", fsal_status.major, fsal_status.minor ) ;
00208 #else
00209        DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_MAJOR, 
00210                           "Error %d,%d from FSAL_rcp when flushing file", fsal_status.major, fsal_status.minor ) ;
00211 #endif
00212 
00213          
00214        /* try to reset the file to its previous name before flushing */
00215        if( rename( datapathmoved, pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data ) == -1 )
00216        {
00217          DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_MAJOR, 
00218                             "Error resetting filename to pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data" ) ;
00219        }
00220        
00221        /* Unlock related Cache Inode pentry */
00222        V( pentry->pentry_inode->lock ) ;
00223 
00224        *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_FSAL_ERROR ;
00225        
00226        /* stat */
00227        pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH] += 1 ;
00228        
00229 
00230        return *pstatus ;
00231      }
00232 
00233     /* To delete or not to delete ? That is the question ... */   
00234     if( flushhow == CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH_AND_DELETE ) 
00235      {
00236         /* Remove the index file from the data cache */
00237         if( unlink( pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_index ) )
00238            {
00239              /* Unlock related Cache Inode pentry */
00240              V( pentry->pentry_inode->lock ) ;
00241 
00242              DisplayLog( "Can't unlink flushed index %s, errno=%u(%s)", pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_index, errno, strerror( errno ) ) ;
00243              *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00244              return *pstatus ;
00245            }
00246 
00247         /* Remove the data file from the data cache */
00248         if( unlink( datapathmoved ) )
00249           {
00250              /* Unlock related Cache Inode pentry */
00251              V( pentry->pentry_inode->lock ) ;
00252 
00253              DisplayLog( "Can't unlink flushed index %s, errno=%u(%s)", datapathmoved, errno, strerror( errno ) ) ;
00254              *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_ERROR ;
00255              return *pstatus ;
00256           }
00257      }
00258 
00259    /* Unlock related Cache Inode pentry */
00260    V( pentry->pentry_inode->lock ) ;
00261  
00262    /* Exit the function with no error */
00263    pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH] += 1 ;
00264    
00265    /* Update the internal metadata */
00266    pentry->internal_md.last_flush_time = time( NULL ) ;
00267    pentry->local_fs_entry.sync_state = SYNC_OK ;
00268    
00269    return *pstatus ;
00270 } /* cache_content_flush */
00271 
00290 cache_content_status_t cache_content_refresh( cache_content_entry_t        * pentry,
00291                                               cache_content_client_t       * pclient,
00292                                               fsal_op_context_t            * pcontext, 
00293                                               cache_content_refresh_how_t    how, 
00294                                               cache_content_status_t       * pstatus )
00295 {
00296   fsal_handle_t           * pfsal_handle = NULL ;
00297    fsal_status_t            fsal_status ;
00298    cache_inode_status_t     cache_inode_status ;
00299    cache_entry_t          * pentry_inode = NULL ;
00300    fsal_path_t              local_path ;
00301    struct stat              buffstat ;
00302    
00303    *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ;
00304    
00305    /* stat */
00306    pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_CONTENT_REFRESH] += 1 ;
00307 
00308    /* Get the related cache inode entry */
00309    pentry_inode = (cache_entry_t *)pentry->pentry_inode ;   
00310 
00311    /* Get the fsal handle */
00312    if( ( pfsal_handle = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( pentry_inode, &cache_inode_status ) ) == NULL )
00313      {
00314        *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_BAD_CACHE_INODE_ENTRY ;
00315        
00316        DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_MAJOR, 
00317                           "cache_content_new_entry: cannot get handle" ) ;
00318        /* stat */
00319        pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_REFRESH] += 1 ;
00320        
00321        return *pstatus ;
00322      }
00323 
00324    /* Convert the path to FSAL path */
00325    fsal_status =  FSAL_str2path( pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data, MAXPATHLEN, &local_path )  ;
00326 
00327    if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00328       {
00329        *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_FSAL_ERROR ;
00330        
00331        /* stat */
00332        pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH] += 1 ;
00333        
00334        return *pstatus ;
00335      }
00336 
00337    /* Stat the data file to check for incoherency (this can occur in a crash recovery context) */
00338    if( stat( pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data, &buffstat ) == -1 )
00339      {
00340        *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_FSAL_ERROR ;
00341 
00342        DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_MAJOR,
00343                           "cache_content_new_entry: could'nt stat on %s, errno=%u(%s)", 
00344                           pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data, errno, strerror( errno ) ) ;
00345 
00346        /* stat */
00347        pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH] += 1 ;
00348 
00349        return *pstatus ;
00350      }  
00351   
00352 #ifdef _DEBUG_FSAL 
00353    if ( how == FORCE_FROM_FSAL )
00354      printf("FORCE FROM FSAL\n");
00355    else
00356      printf("FORCE FROM FSAL PAS ACTIVE\n");
00357 #endif
00358      
00359      
00360    if( ( how != FORCE_FROM_FSAL ) && ( buffstat.st_mtime > (time_t)pentry_inode->object.file.attributes.mtime.seconds ) )
00361      {
00362         *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ;
00363  
00364         DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, "Entry %s is more recent in data cache, keeping it" ) ; 
00365         pentry_inode->object.file.attributes.mtime.seconds  = buffstat.st_mtime ;
00366         pentry_inode->object.file.attributes.mtime.nseconds = 0 ;
00367         pentry_inode->object.file.attributes.atime.seconds  = buffstat.st_atime ;
00368         pentry_inode->object.file.attributes.atime.nseconds = 0 ;
00369         pentry_inode->object.file.attributes.ctime.seconds  = buffstat.st_ctime ;
00370         pentry_inode->object.file.attributes.ctime.nseconds = 0 ;
00371      }
00372    else
00373      {
00374 #ifdef _USE_PROXY
00375        fsal_status = FSAL_rcp_by_name( &(pentry_inode->object.file.pentry_parent_open->object.dir_begin.handle),
00376                                        pentry_inode->object.file.pname, 
00377                                        pcontext,
00378                                        &local_path,
00379                                        FSAL_RCP_FS_TO_LOCAL ) ; 
00380 #else
00381        /* Write the data from the local data file to the fs file */
00382        fsal_status = FSAL_rcp( pfsal_handle, 
00383                                pcontext, 
00384                                &local_path,
00385                                FSAL_RCP_FS_TO_LOCAL ) ;
00386 #endif
00387        if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00388          {
00389            *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_FSAL_ERROR ;
00390  
00391 #ifdef _USE_PROXY 
00392            DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_MAJOR,
00393                               "FSAL_rcp_by_name failed for %s: fsal_status.major=%u fsal_status.minor=%u", 
00394                                pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data, fsal_status.major, fsal_status.minor ) ;
00395 #else
00396            DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_MAJOR,
00397                               "FSAL_rcp failed for %s: fsal_status.major=%u fsal_status.minor=%u", 
00398                                pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data, fsal_status.major, fsal_status.minor ) ;
00399 #endif
00400      
00401            /* stat */
00402            pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_CONTENT_REFRESH] += 1 ;
00403            
00404            return *pstatus ;
00405          }
00406    
00407    
00408        /* Exit the function with no error */
00409        pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_CONTENT_REFRESH] += 1 ;
00410    
00411        /* Update the internal metadata */
00412        pentry->internal_md.last_refresh_time = time( NULL ) ;
00413        pentry->local_fs_entry.sync_state = SYNC_OK ;
00414    
00415      }
00416 
00417    return *pstatus ;
00418 } /* cache_content_refresh */
00419 
00420 cache_content_status_t cache_content_sync_all( cache_content_client_t     * pclient,
00421                                                fsal_op_context_t                * pcontext, 
00422                                                cache_content_status_t     * pstatus ) 
00423 {
00424    *pstatus = CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ;
00425   return *pstatus ;
00426 } /* cache_content_sync_all */
